CvSU Vision Republic of the Philippines CvSU Mission The premier university in CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY Cavite State University shall provide historic Cavite recognized for excellent, equitable and relevant educational excellence in the development Tanza Campus opportunities in the arts, science and of globally competitive and Bagtas, Tanza, Cavite technology through quality instruction and morally upright individuals.  (046) 414-3979 relevant research and development activities. It shall produce professional, skilled and www.cvsu.edu.ph morally upright individuals for global competitiveness.
TEACHER EDUCATION DEPARTMENT COURSE SYLLABUS 2 Semester, AY 2020-2021 nd Course Course Title Type Lecture  Credit Units Code BSEE 39 Technical Writing Laboratory ___ 3 Course Provides a study of representative literary works by early and contemporary African and Asian writers. Description Pre- None Course Schedule: Lecture: requisites Laboratory: Students are expected to live by and stand for the following University tenets:
TRUTH is demonstrated by the student’s objectivity and honesty during examinations, class activities and in the development of projects.
Core EXCELLENCE is exhibited by the students’ self-confidence, punctuality, diligence and commitment in the assigned tasks, class Values performance and other course requirements.
SERVICE is manifested by the students’ respect, rapport, fairness and cooperation in dealing with their peers and members of the community. In addition, they should exhibit love and respect for nature and support for the cause of humanity.
Goals of Cavite State University – Tanza Campus shall endeavor to achieve the following goals: the 1. Provide high quality instruction in order to produce skilled, morally upright and globally competitive graduates; College/ 2. Develop and pursue advance research activities through arts, sciences and technology to support instruction; and Campus 3. Develop and Conduct extension activities that will empower local people and communities

The Teacher Education Department (TED) intends to accomplish the following objectives: Objectives 1. Provide relevant and quality course offering for pre-service teachers to improve their performance; of the 2. Conduct relevant researches in the teacher education and allied courses to produce good leaders and professionals; and Department 3. Conduct relevant community services to disseminate information and technologies to target clienteles to improve their well- being. Program Educational Objectives (based on the English Program CMO No. 75 s.2017) 1. Articulate the rootedness of education in philosophical, socio-cultural, historical, psychological, and political contexts. 2. Demonstrate mastery of subject matter/discipline. 3. Facilitate learning using a wide range of teaching methodologies and delivery modes appropriate to specific learners and their environments. 4. Develop innovative curricula, instructional plans, teaching approaches, and resources for diverse learners. 5. Apply skills in the development and utilization of ICT to promote quality, relevant, and sustainable educational practices. 6. Demonstrate a variety of thinking skills in planning, monitoring, assessing, and reporting learning processes and outcomes. 7. Practice professional and ethical teaching standards sensitive to the local, national, and global realities. 1. 8. Pursue lifelong learning for personal and professional growth through varied experiential and field-based opportunities. Student Outcomes and Relationship to Program Educational Objectives Program Educational Objectives Code (based on the Program/Student Outcomes (based on the program CMO) program CMO) 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 At the end of the course, the pre-service teachers will be able to: a. Possess broad knowledge of language and literature for effective learning         Use English as a glocal language in a multilingual context as it applies to the b.         teaching of language and literature c. Acquire extensive reading background in language, literature, and allied fields         d. Demonstrate proficiency in oral and written communication         Shows competence in employing innovative language and literature teaching e.         approaches, methodologies, and strategies f. Use technology in facilitating language learning and teaching         Inspire students and colleagues to lead relevant and transformative changes to g.         improve learning and teaching language and literature Display skills and abilities to be a reflective and research-oriented language and h.         literature teacher Course Outcomes and Relationship to Student Outcomes Program Outcomes Addressed by the Course Program/Student Outcomes Code After completing this course, the students must be able to: A B C D E F G H 1. Communicate appropriately in the workplace I E E I D I D I
V02-2020-07-01

Total Class Hours/Semester: (3 unit Lec – 54 hrs; 2 unit Lec – 36 hrs) (1 unit Lab – 54 hrs; 2 units Lab – 108 hrs; 3 units Lab – 162 hrs) CLASS POLICIES A. Attendance Students are not allowed to have 20% or more unexcused absences of the total face to face class hours; otherwise, they will be graded as “DROPPED”.
B. Classroom Decorum
During face to face mode Students are required to: 1. wear identification cards at all times;
V02-2020-07-01

2. wear face mask at all times 3. observe physical/social distancing at all times 4. clean the classroom before and after classes; 5. avoid unnecessary noise that might disturb other classes; 6. practice good manners and right conduct at all times; 7. practice gender sensitivity and awareness inside the classroom; and 8. come to class on time.
During distance mode Students are required to: 1. sign an honor system pledge; 2. avoid giving or receiving unauthorized aid of any kind on their examinations, papers, projects and assignments, 3. observe proper netiquette during on-line activities, and 4. submit take home assignments on time.
C. Examination/ Evaluation 1. Quizzes may be announced or unannounced. 2. Mid-term and Final Examinations are scheduled. 3. Cheating is strictly prohibited. A student who is caught cheating will be given a score of ”0” for the first offense. For the second offense, the student will be automatically given a failing grade in the subject. 4. Students who will miss a mid-term or final examination, a laboratory exercise or a class project may be excused and allowed to take a special exam, conduct a laboratory exercise or pass a class project for any of the following reasons: a. participation in a University/College-approved field trip or activity; b. due to illness or death in the family; and c. due to force majeure or natural calamities. General Instruction: ● This exam will be answered via google form. The link will be posted in the LMS and
in the group chat. Accomplish the exam on or before April 23, 2021 (Friday). ● No exam shall be accepted after the due date.
I. Select the letter of the correct answer. (100 points)
1. “The figures must be TRANSMUTED in order to understand the grade.” The capitalized word means: A. Estimated C. Changed B. Surpassed D. Summed
2. The candidate from the [Philippines showed admirable composure in front of the huge Miss Universe audience; her _______ impressed the judges. A. Nervousness C. Aplomb B. Excitement D. Agitation
3. HE is the heaviest player in the basketball team. A. Direct object C. Object compliment B. Indirect object D. Subject compliment
4. Almost two thirds of the population today ____ poor. A. is C. has been B. are D. were
5. Mark’s family lives ____ Ipil Street. A. at C. on B. to D. in
6. I love playing ____ my cat. A. with C. to B. by D. as

7. I can’t find ____ calculator; may I use ____, Gian? A. My, yours C. My, his B. His, yours D. Your, mine
8. The morning air smells ______ in the garden. A. Sweetly C. More sweet B. Sweeter D. Sweet
9. Let us campaign for the total ban _______ of harmful pesticides. A. On the use C. On using B. With using D. With the use
10. What does this passage say about life? “Life is but walking shadow, a pun player that struts and frets … and is heard no more.” A. Life is just a passing stage C. Life is limited B. Life has its end D. Life is everchanging
11. What figure of speech is the following? The EDSA bloodless revolution was supported by a “sea of humanity” united by a common aspiration. A. Simile C. Hyperbole B. Metaphor D. Personification
12. “If you want the moon I will get it for you” is an example of: A. Hyperbole C. Synecdoche B. Irony D. Personification
13. “My concept of inner peace came from my mother’s daily activities which I now recall with fondness and awe. She was a full-time housewife, wholly dependent on my father’s monthly salary. How she made both ends meet, guided us in our studies and did small acts of charity on the side was beyond me.” The mother’s financial resources are ___________. A. More than enough C. Abundant B. miserable D. Limited
14. Haiku is a traditional Japanese poem consisting of A. Three lines totaling 17 syllabus C. Four lines that rhyme with love as topic with nature as topic B. Eight lines ending in rhyming D. Lines of poetry in free verse with ordinary couplet with death as topic thing as topic
15. Who has always been called the Morning Star of English literature? A. Lord Tennyson C. William Shakespeare B. Sir Walter Scott D. Geoffrey Chaucer
16. He is considered the greatest English writer. He is also known as the “bard of Avon”. A. Geoffrey Chaucer C. William Shakespeare B. Sir William Scott D. Francis Bacon
17. According to current linguistic theories, which of the following is the best definition of the meaning of a word? A. Its general, dictionary C. Its corresponding idea in the mind definition B. Its object to where it refers D. Its use in a particular situation

18. What is the manner in which the body is carried in oral speaking? A. Gesture C. Poise B. Posture D. Platform presence
19. What is concerned about high and low voice volume and quality? A. Pitch C. Resonance B. Tone D. Timbre
20. Which of the following words is misspelled? A. Accomplishment C. Acommodate B. Accountancy D. Accuracy
21. What are the two digits which when inserted in the blank spaces will make 234___ divisible by 8? A. 3 and 2 C. 5 and 6 B. 0 and 0 D. All of the above
22. Which of the following is NOT true about the sum of two consecutive odd integers? A. It is even C. It is divisible by 4 B. It is divisible only by 12 D. It is always divisible by 1
23. The Least Common Multiple (LCM) of 2, 3, and 4 is ______. A. 13 C. 14 B. 24 D. 12
24. Find the prime divisors of 60. A. 12, 5 C. 4, 15 B. 3, 5 D. 6, 10
th 25. In the example of 10 to the 5 power + 6x the exponent is A. y C. 5 B. 6 D. 10
26. The ratio of the number of boys to the number of girls in a class is 2:3. If there are 40 students in the class, how many boys are there? A. 8 C. 16 B. 18 D. 24
27. Solve for the value of x to make x:8 = 4:16 true. A. 1 C. 3 B. 2 D. 4
28. What number must be subtracted from both numerator and denominator of the fraction 11/23 to give a fraction whose value is 2/5? A. 2 C. 5 B. 4 D. 3
29. Margo paid P400 for a blouse. If the blouse was sold at 20% discount, what was its original price? A. P80 C. P480 B. P500 D. P540

30. Mendoza company manufactures sofa sets. In its catalog, a rectangular sofa is priced at P5,000.00 less a discount of 25%. What will Happy Department Store have to pay for the rectangular sofa? A. P4,250.00 C. P4,000.00 B. P3,800.00 D. P3,750.00
31. A receipt calls for 2 eggs for every cup of flour. If a head chef uses 28 cups of flour, how many eggs will he need? A. 56 eggs C. 65 eggs B. 14 eggs D. 55 eggs
32. A pancake was cut into 8 pieces. Three brothers ate one piece each. How many part of the cake was left? A. ½ C. 5/8 B. 2/8 D. 1/4
33. What is the amount due at the end of 2 years if P10,000.00 is invested at 8% annual simple interest? A. P10,600 C. P11,600 B. P12,500 D. P13,500
34. A blue neon light blinks every 4 seconds. A red one blinks every 5 seconds while a green one blinks every 6 seconds. How many times will they blink together in half an hour? A. 1 C. 5 B. 10 D. 30
35. In an English test, eight students obtained the following scores: 10, 15, 12, 18, 16, 24, 12, and 14. What is the median score? A. 14 C. 14.5 B. 15.5 D. 15
36. What measure of central tendency can best describe the style of backpacks commonly used by travelers? A. Mean C. Mode B. Range D. Median
37. The application of specific concepts and principles. A. Biology C. Technology B. Ecology D. Science
38. It is the process of storing, receiving, and disseminating recorded data through the computer. A. Information Technology C. Information Retrieval B. Information Utilization D. Information Science
39. What do you call the board that forms the foundation of your computer? A. Motherboard C. Main memory B. ROM D. RAM
40. Messages are easily transported anywhere in the world through the _______. A. E-shopping C. E-registry B. E-mail D. E-learning

41. If the school is considered as an agent of social and cultural change, it should function as? A. Transmitter of culture C. Perpetuator of tradition B. Pioneer of programs D. Innovator of instructions
42. Professionals going abroad to seek greener pastures as one type of: A. Brain drain C. Tourism B. Employment D. Migration
43. It is perceived as the most important need and most pressing problem of the Filipino family: A. Unemployment or financial C. Prone to vice problem B. Broken family D. Double standard on roles
44. What does a professional code of ethics prescribe for all? A. Moral standards and ethical C. Strict law implementation behavior B. Rules and regulations in D. Civility and social-consciousness practicing one’s profession
45. Suffrage is a privilege in a democracy. Those who are deprived of their voting rights are normally ___________. A. Penalized C. Disenfranchised B. Criminally-liable D. Imprisoned
46. Developing mines require getting a DENR clearance. Which of the following clearances are required? A. Air pollution clearance C. Environmental clearance B. Waste disposal clearance D. LGU clearance
47. There are 3 fundamental human rights according to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. These are: A. Life, security, and C. Life, economy, and self-development self-development B. Life, dignity, and security D. Life, liberty, and security
48. The fundamental right invoked by filing the “writ of amparo” is __________. A. The right to due process C. The right to be defended by a public attorney B. The right to self-defense D. The right to life, liberty, and security
49. Which of the following state is the right to human dignity? A. Property ownership C. Honor and reputation B. Fair Trial D. Political independence
50. The government wants a piece of private land for a government project. The owner resisted the government’s demand. How may the government own the land? A. Right of eminent domain C. Right of habeas corpus B. Right of government D. Right of a sovereign over the governed ownership
51. Which best describes the division of the legislature into the Senate and the House of Representatives? A. Bicameralism C. Unicameralism

B. Bipartisanship D. Co-legislative powers
52. Which religious missionaries first arrived in the Philippines? A. Dominicans C. Jesuits B. Franciscan D. Augustinians
53. What was the term given by Marcelo H. Del Pilar to hidden control and domination by Spanish religious priests over the colonial government? A. Pase region C. Las suerte partidas B. Complace D. Frailocracia
54. The resettlement of the Filipino communities to town centers called cabeceras was provided by the Spanish policy called ____________. A. Encomienda C. Pueblo B. Reduccion D. Gobernadorcillo
55. During the 17 th – 18 th century Hispanic era, what was the highest post a native Chinese mestizo can attain at the municipal level, equivalent to local bureaucrats namely the mayors today? A. Governadorcillo C. Tanientes de justicia B. Cabeza de barangay D. Directorcillo
56. Ang mga sumusunod maliban sa isa ay mga sagisag panulat ni Marcelo H. Del Pilar. Ito ay ang ________. A. Pupdoh C. Dolores Manapat B. Kinting Kulirat D. Piping Dilat
57. Which was the first labor union in the country founded by Isabelo delos Reyes on July 1901? A. Association of Philippine Labor C. Union Trabajadores de Filipinos B. Union Obrera Democratia D. Association de Compania Tabacalera
58. Who was the last Spanish Governor-General of the Philippines? A. Ramon Blanco C. Diego de los Rios B. Basilio Agustin D. Fermin Jaudenes
59. Of the seven continents comprising continuous land mass surrounded by big bodies of water, the biggest (30.1% of the Earth) is ___________. A. Asia C. Australia B. Europe D. Northern America
60. Which is the largest country in Asia? A. China C. Philippines B. Japan D. Thailand
61. Food, plants, and other animal wastes should be segregated in waste disposal because ________________________. A. These are biodegradable C. These are disease-carrier B. These are non-biodegradable D. They are unsanitary
62. Dengue is an infectious disease transmitted by an organism classified under which phylum? A. Chordate C. Hemichordala B. Arthropoda D. Echinodermata

63. Which of the following is an example of a useful function for bacteria? A. Can clean up an oil spill by C. Can synthesize new forms of heavy digesting hydrocarbons metals B. May be used as vectors to D. May be pathogenic and cause human introduce proteins disease
64. Which of the following is not used in the manufacture of food by green plants? A. Carbon dioxide C. Water and soil nutrients B. Sun D. Oxygen
65. A root may perform all of the following functions except? A. Photosynthesis C. Food storage B. Anchorage D. Water absorption
66. What is the process used by plants to convert the energy from sunlight into chemical energy? A. Diffusion C. Pytochemical conversion B. Photosynthesis D. Cytolysis
67. During respiration, green plants take in? A. Water C. Oxygen B. Carbon dioxide D. Carbon dioxide and water
68. Is the relationship between an organism and a host where neither is benefited nor harmed: A. Commensalism C. Parasitic B. Competitive D. Mutualism
69. Living and feeding on leaves by the caterpillar is an example of _________ relationship. A. Competitive C. Parasitic B. Mutualistic D. Predatory
70. Which of the following is a heterotroph? A. Moss C. Algae B. Grasshopper D. Fern
71. What organism would most likely be in an arctic environment? A. Turtle C. Crocodile B. Maya bird D. Walrus
72. Monosaccharides, oligosaccharides, and polysaccharides are types of ________. A. Lipids C. Nucleotides B. Proteins D. Carbohydrates
73. The following organs have specific functions except: A. Intestine C. Pancreas B. Liver D. Appendix
74. Which element has Ca as its symbol? A. Calcium C. Carbon B. Cadmium D. Californium

75. Perfumes contain organic compounds called: A. Alcohol C. Acids B. Ethers D. Esters
76. Milk is classified as: A. Colloid C. Acid B. Metalloid D. Soda
77. Which of the following statements is true about textbook laid on the table? A. No force is acting on it C. The sum of the forces acting upon it is zero B. The textbook undergoes D. The textbook undergoes deceleration acceleration
78. A paperclip can sit on the surface of water due to ___________. A. Surface tension C. Buoyancy B. Atmospheric pressure D. Viscosity
79. People on earth experience day and night regularly every 24 hours. Why is that so? A. Because the Earth rotates on C. Because the Earth tilts on its own axis its own axis B. Because the Earth revolves on D. Because the Earth revolves around the its own axis sun
80. Which of the following causes seasons? A. The rotation of the Earth about C. The distance of the Earth form the Sun the Sun B. The rotation of the Sun about D. The tilting of the Earth on its axis the Earth
81. __________ ngayon kaysa kahapon. A. Mainit C. Mainitan B. Mainit-init D. Mag-init
82. Bigyang pagpapakahulugan ang salitang LINANGAN sa pangungusap na “Linangan ng Pilipinas”. A. Pamahalaan C. Unibersidad B. Silid-aklatan D. Ahensya
83. Piliin ang salitang walang diptonggo. A. Musika C. Bahay B. Kasuy D. Sisiw
84. Ano ang pinakapayak na anyo ng salita na walang kahalong lapi? A. Ponema C. Laguhan B. Gitlapi D. Saliang ugat
85. Uri ng pagbabagong morpoponemiko na gumagamit ng pagpapalit posisyon ng ponema sa salita. A. Asimilasyon C. Paglalapi B. Pagkaltas D. Metatesis
86. Paraan ng pagbasa kung saan ang akda ya mahirap unawain: A. Preview C. Muling basa

B. Masusi D. Kaswal
87. Alin sa mga sumusunod ang pang-akademikong gamit ng wika? A. Pag-aalinlangan C. Pagtanaw B. Pagsasaliksik D. Kwentuhan
88. Ipinagmamalaki mo siya, BAHAG naman pala ANG kanyang BUNTOT. A. Kuripot C. Mahiyain B. Duwag D. Traydor
89. Anong sawikain ang nagpapahalaga sa “utang na loob”? A. Huli man daw at magaling ay C. Kung may isinuksok, may dudukutin nahahabol din B. Habang may buhay may D. Ang hindi lumingon sa pinanggalingan ay pag-asa di makakarating sa paroroonan
90. Sa pagbuo ng analohiya, ano sa sumusunod ang may katulad na relasyon ng pares na nakalahad sa: parang binubuhusan ng malamig na tubig: napahiya A. Parang maamong tupa:mabait C. Parang pinitpit na luya: maanghang B. Parang malayo ang paningin: D. Parang may paru-paro sa tiyan:nagugutom mayabang
91. Tukuyin ang salitang naiiba sa kahulugan: kinain, nilapa, sinibasib, inumin A. Kinain C. Sinibasib B. Nilapa D. Inumin
92. Sa pangungusap na “Malakas ang boses mo,” ang salitang malakas ay isang _____. A. Pangatnig C. Panghalip B. Pang-uri D. Pandiwa
93. Pangungusap na tumutukoy sa pangyayaring pangkalikasan o pangkapaligiran. A. Temporal C. Eksistensyal B. Penomenal D. Modal
94. “Kapalaran, huwag ka sanang mailap.” A. Pagtawag C. Palit-saklaw B. Pagmamalabis D. Palit-tawag
95. Who was the literary figure known as “Huseng Sisiw”? A. Jose dela Cruz C. Juan Matapang Cruz B. Jose Rizal D. Francisco Baltazar
96. Ang kauna-unahang nagsalin sa Tagalog ng MI ULTIMO ADIOS ni Jose Rizal ay si _________. A. Emilio Jacinto C. Andres Bonifacio B. Apolinario Mabini D. Rafael Palma
97. Ito ay isang dulang nagsasalaysay ng uhay at kamatayan ng ating Mahal na poong Hesukristi at masasabing parang PASYONG itinatanghal sa entablado. A. Moro-moro C. Senakulo B. Karagatan D. Duplo
98. Ang mga sumusunod maliban sa isa ay ilan sa mga akdang pampanitikang nagdala ng malaking impluwensya sa buong daigdig. A. Ang Koran C. Ang Banal na Kasulatan

B. Ang Divinia Comedia D. Ang Romeo at Julieta
99. Kalian nagsimula ang pagkakataon ng modernisasyon ng Wikang Pambansa? A. 1974 C. 1997 B. 1987 D. 1988
100. Ayon sa teoryang ito, ang salita ay nagsimula sa tunog ng kalikasan. A. Bow-wow C. Tarara-boom-de-ay B. Pooh-pooh D. Teoryang Yoheho

University Vision and Mission What does the Cavite State University want to become? The University envisions
itself as "the premier University in historic Cavite recognized for excellence in
the development of morally upright and globally competitive individuals". To
achieve this vision, the University "shall provide excellent, equitable and relevant educational opportunities in the arts, science and technology through quality I instruction and relevant research and development activities. It shall produce
professional, skilled and morally upright individuals for global
competitiveness." In addition to the vision and mission, the University shall abide by and adhere to
its commitment to the tenets of Truth, Excellence and Service.
The University has already set the stage for what it wants to be in no uncertain terms - to become one I among the best state colleges and universities noted for /' I '· excellence in instruction, rrsearch and community service.
The Planning Process I I A Management Tr ining and Strategic Pia� ing Workshop was held on 24-27 9

and objectives of the University; d) respond to the changes in the environment in the d mands � region and in the country including the increasing for global linkages; and e) in line with the national development agenda and t�e development agenda for higher
education in the country." Further, the University development plan shall be "in I consonance with the requirements of the overall regional and national development I

The accomplishments of the University along the major final outputs (MFOs) were reviewed and challenges have been identified. Inputs to the planning process include
